column4: and if I understood right, the desktop install cd will work as a LiveCD and then offers me the option to install it permanently?
note the installer with the livecd is alpha and doesn't work on a lot of pc's
So, what will happen when I boot the desktop CD?
the desktop one is the live cd...it is a normal live cd with a gentoo style gui installer which you can click to install or just use the disc as a normal live cd
and during the install process, I will be able to select all the options I need to still keep running WinXP (make separate partition)?
indeed...note you should make sure you have the free space for the partition already assigned - it cannot resize a windows parition for you without killing the data on it
